title: Religious Pushkar Town For Your Rajasthan Holiday
text:
Religious Pushkar Town For Your Rajasthan Holiday Religious Pushkar Town For Your Rajasthan Holiday 
Only Hindu devotees visit the place frequently once upon a time but in addition to the devotees these days large population of tourists also landed here because of its attractive features. 
HIGHLIGHTS OF THE TOWN: 
Pushkar Camel Fair - The fair is famous throughout the world and largest fair for camel trading. During this festival common tourists and local people can celebrate precious time with great fun and happiness. It is one of the best celebrations to experience and witness the cultural heritage of the region. International visitors are delighted by the cultural programmes perform during the festival. Captivating as well as entertaining programmes are Tug-of-War Competition, Best Moustache Competition, Turban Wearing Competition and other folk dances and music. Camel trading also takes place during the festival. The entertaining festival is celebrated from October to November. 
BRAHMA TEMPLE - Indians are highly religious and spiritual. A visitor can experience and witness these through their cultural celebrations and lifestyle. The town is sacred place of worship and located one and only Brahma Temple. The temple is the single religious site where worshiping Lord Brahma and according to Hindu mythology it was the religious site where Lord Budha performed Yogya with others Hindu gods and goddesses. Discover the religious value of the temple and architectural design of the building. Offer prayer in the temple to have a successful life. 
Other places of worship in the region you can visit as a part of your Rajasthan tour are Warah Temple, Savitri Temple, Rangji Temple, Ramavaikunth Temple, Apteshwar Temple and Mahadeva Temple. 
PUSHKAR LAKE: Among the stunning lakes in the state one of the captivating is Pushkar Lake. This is one of the beautiful lakes in the town and one of the religious sites to perform ritual activities during the celebration of Pushkar Festival. In and around the Lake there are more than 52 Ghats and during the festival the site is overflow with the sounds of bells from the temples. You can explore more than 350 temples around the picturesque lake. 
To reach this place is very easy in present days. The town is well connected by different means of transportation and no need to worry to hold couple of nights in the region.
